In the past 50 years, the average annual difference between the mean surface soil temperature and mean air temperature was 2.05 °C ( Figure 8). Across seasons,
T D
was highest in summer (2.76 °C), followed by autumn (2.13 °C) and spring (1.76 °C). Furthermore, it was smallest in winter (1.55 °C). Across all stations, the average
T D
decreased by 0.3 °C over 50 years. The decrease in
T D
was highest in winter (0.8 °C), followed by that in summer (0.3 °C) and autumn (0.15 °C). The opposite trend was found in summer (increase of 0.2 °C).
